<a id="XMLParser"></a>

# XMLParser

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Provides a low-level interface for creating parsers for XML files.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Provides a low-level interface for creating parsers for [XML](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML) files. This class can serve as base to make custom XML parsers.

To parse XML, you must open a file with the [open()](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_method_open) method or a buffer with the [open_buffer()](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_method_open_buffer) method. Then, the [read()](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_method_read) method must be called to parse the next nodes. Most of the methods take into consideration the currently parsed node.

Here is an example of using **XMLParser** to parse an SVG file (which is based on XML), printing each element and its attributes as a dictionary:




```gdscript
    var parser = XMLParser.new()
    parser.open("path/to/file.svg")
    while parser.read() != ERR_FILE_EOF:
        if parser.get_node_type() == XMLParser.NODE_ELEMENT:
            var node_name = parser.get_node_name()
            var attributes_dict = {}
            for idx in range(parser.get_attribute_count()):
                attributes_dict[parser.get_attribute_name(idx)] = parser.get_attribute_value(idx)
            print("The ", node_name, " element has the following attributes: ", attributes_dict)
```


```csharp
    var parser = new XmlParser();
    parser.Open("path/to/file.svg");
    while (parser.Read() != Error.FileEof)
    {
        if (parser.GetNodeType() == XmlParser.NodeType.Element)
        {
            var nodeName = parser.GetNodeName();
            var attributesDict = new Godot.Collections.Dictionary();
            for (int idx = 0; idx < parser.GetAttributeCount(); idx++)
            {
                attributesDict[parser.GetAttributeName(idx)] = parser.GetAttributeValue(idx);
            }
            GD.Print($"The {nodeName} element has the following attributes: {attributesDict}");
        }
    }
```

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_XMLParser_NodeType"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **NodeType**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_XMLParser_NodeType)

<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_NONE** = `0`

There's no node (no file or buffer opened).<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_ELEMENT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_ELEMENT** = `1`

An element node type, also known as a tag, e.g. ``<title>``.<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_ELEMENT_END"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_ELEMENT_END** = `2`

An end of element node type, e.g. ``</title>``.<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_TEXT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_TEXT** = `3`

A text node type, i.e. text that is not inside an element. This includes whitespace.<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_COMMENT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_COMMENT** = `4`

A comment node type, e.g. ``<!--A comment-->``.<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_CDATA"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_CDATA** = `5`

A node type for CDATA (Character Data) sections, e.g. ``<![CDATA[CDATA section]]>``.<a id="XMLParser_constant_NODE_UNKNOWN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **NODE_UNKNOWN** = `6`

An unknown node type.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_attribute_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_attribute_count**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_attribute_count)

Returns the number of attributes in the currently parsed element.

\ **Note:** If this method is used while the currently parsed node is not [NODE_ELEMENT](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_constant_NODE_ELEMENT) or [NODE_ELEMENT_END](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_constant_NODE_ELEMENT_END), this count will not be updated and will still reflect the last element.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_attribute_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_attribute_name**\ (\ idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_attribute_name)

Returns the name of an attribute of the currently parsed element, specified by the `idx` index.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_attribute_value"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_attribute_value**\ (\ idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_attribute_value)

Returns the value of an attribute of the currently parsed element, specified by the `idx` index.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_current_line"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_current_line**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_current_line)

Returns the current line in the parsed file, counting from 0.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_named_attribute_value"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_named_attribute_value**\ (\ name\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_named_attribute_value)

Returns the value of an attribute of the currently parsed element, specified by its `name`. This method will raise an error if the element has no such attribute.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_named_attribute_value_safe"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_named_attribute_value_safe**\ (\ name\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_named_attribute_value_safe)

Returns the value of an attribute of the currently parsed element, specified by its `name`. This method will return an empty string if the element has no such attribute.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_node_data"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_node_data**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_node_data)

Returns the contents of a text node. This method will raise an error if the current parsed node is of any other type.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_node_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_node_name**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_node_name)

Returns the name of a node. This method will raise an error if the currently parsed node is a text node.

\ **Note:** The content of a [NODE_CDATA](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_constant_NODE_CDATA) node and the comment string of a [NODE_COMMENT](XMLParser.md#XMLParser_constant_NODE_COMMENT) node are also considered names.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_node_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_node_offset**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_node_offset)

Returns the byte offset of the currently parsed node since the beginning of the file or buffer. This is usually equivalent to the number of characters before the read position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_get_node_type"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) **get_node_type**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_get_node_type)

Returns the type of the current node. Compare with [NodeType](XMLParser.md#enum_XMLParser_NodeType) constants.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_has_attribute"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_attribute**\ (\ name\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_has_attribute)

Returns ``true`` if the currently parsed element has an attribute with the `name`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_is_empty"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_empty**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_is_empty)

Returns ``true`` if the currently parsed element is empty, e.g. ``&lt;element /&gt;``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_open"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **open**\ (\ file\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_open)

Opens an XML `file` for parsing. This method returns an error code.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_open_buffer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **open_buffer**\ (\ buffer\: [PackedByteArray](PackedByteArray.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_open_buffer)

Opens an XML raw `buffer` for parsing. This method returns an error code.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_read"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **read**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_read)

Parses the next node in the file. This method returns an error code.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_seek"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **seek**\ (\ position\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_seek)

Moves the buffer cursor to a certain offset (since the beginning) and reads the next node there. This method returns an error code.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="XMLParser_method_skip_section"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **skip_section**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#XMLParser_method_skip_section)

Skips the current section. If the currently parsed node contains more inner nodes, they will be ignored and the cursor will go to the closing of the current element.
